text: The Battle of Crécy happened on 26 August 1346 near Crécy in northern France, and was one of the most important battles of the Hundred Years' War. The smaller English army won against the much larger French army. New tactics and weapons make this an important battle in the history of warfare because the English used longbows to win against French knights. The longbow was a faster weapon to fire than the French and Genoan crossbow and could send arrows farther than the crossbow and with more force. Before the battle during the Middle Ages, knights had been the most important part of an army during the Middle Ages. The change causes some historians to call the battle the beginning of the end of chivalry. == Battle == In the battle, the French knights, protected by chain mail reinforced with metal plate, were nearly exhausted by charging several miles into the battle against the wishes of King Philip VI. Their horses had to walk through deep mud and charge up a hill into a storm of English and Welsh arrows and were cut down. Many French nobles died. The knights' horses were barely protected at all. The storm of arrows killed or disabled the horses and left the knights floundering in the mud on foot beneath a hail of arrows. The bolts (heavy arrows) of the Genoese crossbowmen at the forefront of the battle could not reach the English. They fell short because the crossbow strings were wet. The archers had also misjudged the range and shot too early and too low. The English, controlling the high ground, ran a short distance down the hill and pick off the Genoese with volleys of arrows. As the Genoese attempted to retreat, they were cut down by the French knights, who thought the withdrawal was cowardly. That wasted the first charge of French cavalry and left them disorganised for the charge on the English. In a very strong defensive position, King Edward III ordered for everyone to fight on foot. He split the army in three divisions, one of which commanded by his sixteen-year-old son, Edward, the Black Prince. The archers were set in a V-formation along the top of the hill. While they waited, the English built a system of ditches, pits and caltropsCaltrop: a spiked device on the ground to harm enemy men and horses, and slow them down. to hurt and bring down the enemy cavalry. == Notes == * Battle of Auberoche was before this one Crecy Category:1346 Category:1340s in England Category:1340s in France
